scenario_name: Asymmetric Flap due to Torque Shaft Fracture
description: During final approach, a torque shaft on the left wing flap mechanism fractures due to metal fatigue. This causes an immediate asymmetric flap condition, triggering the aircraft's protection system and forcing a go-around.

telemetry_events.description: When flap lever is moved from CONF 2 to CONF 3, the left flap torque shaft fractures.

maintenance_logs.report: PIREP: Reports 'strange noise and slight vibration' from left wing during flap extension and retraction.
maintenance_logs.action: Ground function test performed, tracks lubricated. Could not replicate the issue. Assessed as within acceptable limits.

transcript.sound: Loud, sharp 'CRACK' sound from the left wing area.

transcript.speaker: PF
transcript.dialogue: We've got a flap fault. Flaps locked! Okay, I have control. Maintain speed.

transcript.speaker: PM
transcript.dialogue: ECAM confirms, flaps locked. We have an asymmetric condition. Go-around procedure.

context_data.atc_communication: [Callsign], PAN-PAN, PAN-PAN, PAN-PAN, declaring an emergency due to a flap asymmetry issue. Executing a go-around. Request vectors to hold at 4000 feet for troubleshooting.
